page.title: 14St. JOSEPHS R.C. CHURCH
page.content: The builders began the church in November 1932 and it was completed in January 1934. The cost was just over Â£7500. The foundations needed to be built on a reinforced concrete beam. The parish used to come to our school to attend mass from 1907 until 1934. We have stained glass windows. There are four on the left hand side and three above the altar. There is a statue of St. Joseph above the entrance. The stained glass windows came from an old church in Barnard Castle. In 1948 our church had a marble floor and walls put into the sanctuary. In 1984 the church celebrated it's Golden Jubilee and the school children bought a golden plaque which is now on a lecturn in the sanctuary.
